title: Executive Order 8375-Exemption of James F. Rogers From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that James F. Rogers, Chief Educationist, Office of Education, Federal Security Agency, who, during the month of May, 1940, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said James F. Rogers from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending May 31, 1941.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8375-Exemption of James F. Rogers From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/371567
